title-group.article-title: Evaluation of the Integral $\int^\infty_0 \frac{t^{2\alpha-1} J_\nu( x\sqrt{1 + t^2)}{(1 + t^2)^{\alpha+\beta-1}} dt$

abstract.p:
Methods are developed for evaluating the integral $$I^{\alpha eta}_
u(x) = \int^\infty_0  rac{t^{2\alpha-1} J_
u(x\sqrt{1 + t^2})}{(1 + t^2)^{\alpha  eta-1} dt,$$ where $J_
u(t)$ is the Bessel function of the first kind and order $
u, \alpha > 0,  eta > 1/4$, and $
u$ is real. Only $I^{1/2,1}_
u (x)$ and $I^{\alpha,
u/2+1-\alpha}_
u(x)$ are included in previously published tables of integrals of Bessel functions. The integrals $I^{1/2,1/2}_1(x)$ and $I^{1/2,1}_2(x)$ are used in a technique developed by I. S. Fedorova for calculating the diameter distribution of long circular cylinders from small-angle x-ray, light, or neutron scattering data. The $I^{\alpha eta}_
u(x)$ are shown to be proportional to a $G$ function. From this result, power series expansions and recurrence relations are developed for use in evaluating the $I^{\alpha eta}_
u(x)$. A convenient expression is obtained for the quantity required in Fedorova's method for computing diameter distributions.
